title: How to make friends? How can I influence people - Quora

response.answer_text: First things first,make sure you are choosing the right group of people as your friends.You can do that by checking whether their wavel lengths and yours match.Next,whenever you want to be friends with anyone,the first thing to do is to observe their activities(not stalking)!You can watch them secretly as to what language they use,what topics they discuss,their behavior  etc. After that,now comes the tricky part...try being at places where they are and show that you have common interest,(again no STALKING).Next,if any of their group members didn't come,make sure you ask them as to why he/she didn't come.PS:DO NOT SEEM DESPERATE.ONCE YOU GIVE THAT IDEA NOT ONLY TO FRIENDS BUT ALSO FAMILY MEMBERS,THEY'LL TAKE UNDUE ADVANTAGE OF YOU SLOWLY AND PAINFULLYLastly,sit with them at lunch breaks,recess or coffee breaks and always remember to have happy and lively conversations on stuff that interests both parties.Hope this helps you make more friends.Please do let me know the result after following it,because it's worth a try!

Look mate, I am gonna be honest with you. You don't need to influence people to become friends. There's no magic in it. Friendship is the purest form of any relationship. It is all about trust, loyalty and most importantly honesty. True friendship doesn't mean u gotta pretend to be someone else just for the sake of impressing someone. So, if u r trying to be someone else, to make new friends, that is not friendship that is forgery or impersonation.If they r not liking you back, fine, forget about them, move on, they don't deserve to be your friends. Find people who like you for who you are in reality. Not gonna give u lots of lectures about friendship. Just gonna give u one free advice, just be yourself and trust me it's gonna work. Trust me, it's better to have a few friends who actually care than to have a long list of "so called" friends who just wanna be friends because of their own selfish interests. That kind of friendship is not a friendship at all. It's an insult to it.

There are of course many tips that can help us interact better, but nothing will ever replace diplomacy and understanding. When dealing with others, regardless of the situation, the only thing we should keep in mind is to treat others the way we’d like to be treated. Dale Carnegie’s on that topic book is wonderful.
